Deployment Guide

Building

Build your entire 11ty site withÂ functionsÂ included.

npm run build

This:

  1. Generates 11tyÂ site
  2. Copies functions toÂ _site/functions/
  3. Injects version numbers into distÂ files

Verify functions areÂ copied:

ls _site/functions/

Deployment Methods

Method 1: Wrangler CLI (Recommended)

Simplest andÂ mostÂ commonÂ method.

# Deploy toÂ production
wrangler publish

# Deploy toÂ specificÂ environment
wrangler publish â€“env production

# Deploy toÂ staging
wrangler publish â€“env staging

Method 2: GitHub Actions

Automate deployment onÂ push.

#.github/workflows/deploy.yml
name: Deploy

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '18'
      - run: npm install
      - run: npm run build
      - name: Deploy to Cloudflare
        run: npx wrangler publish
        env:
          CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN: $

Method 3: Wrangler Pages

Deploy your entire site +Â functions.

# Create PagesÂ project
wrangler pages project create my-project

#Â Deploy
wrangler pages deploy _site --project-name=my-project

Configuration forÂ Production

wrangler.toml Setup

name = â€œmy-projectâ€
main = â€œfunctions/index.jsâ€
compatibility_date = â€œ2024-10-21â€
type = â€œserviceâ€

[env.production]
name = â€œmy-project-prodâ€
routes = [
  { pattern = â€œexample.com/api/*â€, zone_id = â€œyour-zone-idâ€ }
]
vars = { ENVIRONMENT = â€œproductionâ€ }

[env.staging]
name = â€œmy-project-stagingâ€
routes = [
  { pattern = â€œstaging.example.com/api/*â€, zone_id = â€œyour-zone-idâ€ }
]
vars = { ENVIRONMENT = â€œstagingâ€ }

Environment Variables

Set secrets inÂ Wrangler:

# Set forÂ production
wrangler secret put API_KEY â€“env production

# Set forÂ staging

[env.production]

  ENVIRONMENT = â€œproductionâ€
}

[env.production.secrets]

Deployment Process

Step 1: Verify Build

CheckÂ output:

Step 2: Test Locally

Visit Â§Â§URLÂ§Â§49Â§Â§ andÂ testÂ endpoints.

Step 3: Authenticate

Step 4: Deploy

Step 5: Verify Deployment

# Check deployedÂ version
wrangler tail

# Test deployedÂ endpoint
curl https://your-domain.com/api/hello

Troubleshooting

Functions Not Deploying

Problem: wranglerÂ publish fails withÂ â€œNoÂ functionsÂ foundâ€

Solution: Ensure functions areÂ inÂ _site/functions/:

npm run build
ls _site/functions/
wrangler publish

Environment Variables Not Available

Problem: env.API_KEY isÂ undefined

Solution: Set inÂ wrangler.toml:

[env.production]
vars = { API_KEY = â€œyour-valueâ€ }

OrÂ useÂ secrets:

wrangler secret put API_KEY â€“env production

Timeout Errors

Problem: Functions timingÂ out

Solution: Check forÂ long-runningÂ operations:

// âœ— TooÂ slow
async function slowOperation() {
  await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 60,000)); // 60Â seconds
}

// âœ“Â Better
async function fastOperation() {
  // Keep under 30Â seconds
  const timeout = Promise.race([
    doWork(),
    new Promise((_,Â reject) =>
      setTimeout(() => reject(new Error(â€˜Timeoutâ€™)), 25,000)
    )
  ]);
}

Performance Tips

  1. Keep functionsÂ small â€“ Faster coldÂ starts
  2. Avoid N+1Â queries â€“ Batch databaseÂ requests
  3. Use KV forÂ data â€“ Store frequently accessedÂ data
  4. MonitorÂ logs â€“ Check wranglerÂ tail forÂ issues

Cost Optimization

  • Requests: First 100,000/dayÂ free
  • ColdÂ starts: Optimize functionÂ size
  • KVÂ storage: Consider costs forÂ largeÂ datasets

Security Best Practices

  1. UseÂ secrets â€“ Never hardcode APIÂ keys
  2. ValidateÂ input â€“ Check requestÂ data
  3. LogÂ carefully â€“ Donâ€™t log sensitiveÂ data
  4. UseÂ HTTPS â€“ Always use secureÂ connections
